```{r in}

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2022-03-01')
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2022, week = 9)

stations <- tuesdata$stations

# Or read in the data manually

stations <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2022/2022-03-01/stations.csv')


```

```{r out}
folder_name <- "20220301-W09-Alternative Fuel Stations"
data_name <- names(tuesdata)

for (i in seq_along(data_name)) {
  write.csv(tuesdata[[i]],here::here(paste0("2022/", folder_name),paste0(data_name[i],".csv")), row.names = F, na = "")
}
```
